page.title: 12Cockfield Fell 2. Stints.
page.content: In 1865 The Fell was made a regulated pasture with the freeholders at that time being allocated grazing rights. The administration of The Fell rests with a group of Field Reeves who are appointed by the present stint holders.A Stint is a document giving grazing rights on The Fell.There are 1100 stints altogether.Originally 1 stint gave the right to graze 1 beast, 3 horses or 8 sheep.Today the stints seem to give more general rights.Some stint holders have pigeon lofts or other small buildings on The Fell. No animals are allowed to graze on The Fell in April in order that the grass may grow.The River Gaunless flows across The Fell providing swimming,fishing and other water pleasures for local children.
